entries: {@variantrule Armor Penetration|GW}, {@variantrule Overcast|GW|Overcast:} 2
Sear an enemy with a magical obsidian flame.

Choose one creature that you can see within range. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 2d10} force damage. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage.
Obsidian Flame
Spell. Deal 22...94...112 damage to target foe. This spell ignores armor.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: "Shields Up!"
entries: {@variantrule Shout|GW}
Warn your allies of incoming ranged attacks, increasing their defense against them.

Choose any number of creatures that can hear you within range. For the duration, whenever a target takes damage from a ranged weapon attack, you can roll {@dice 2d6} and subtract the number rolled from the damage.
"Shields Up!"
Shout. For 5...10...11 seconds, you and all party members within earshot gain +60 armor against incoming projectile attacks.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the number subtracted increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Signet of Agony
entries: {@variantrule Sacrifice|GW|Sacrifice:} 10%, {@variantrule Signet|GW|Signet:} Short Rest
Feed your signet of agony with your blood to release a devastating blast of necromantic energy around you.
For the duration, you start {@condition bleeding|GW}, taking {@damage 1d6} damage.

Target each creature other than you within a 15-foot Emanation. Each target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 6d8} necrotic damage. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage.
At the end of each of your turns, you can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the condition ends.
Signet of Agony
Signet. You suffer from Bleeding for 25 seconds. All nearby foes take 10...58...70 damage.

spell.name: Flame Trap
entries: Prepare a flame trap, which damages and burns creatures which trigger it.

Conjure a 15-foot radius stationary {@condition invisible} trap at your location for the duration and choose any number of creatures. The next time a non-chosen creature enters the spell's area, the trap triggers, applying the following effect for 3 rounds:

Each non-chosen creature must make a Dexterity saving throw when it enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage and starts {@condition burning} for one minute, taking {@damage 1d6} damage. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and {@condition burning|GW|burns} for 1 round only.
At the end of each of its turns, a target can make a Dexterity saving throw. On a success, the condition ends.
This trap is nearly {@condition invisible}, requiring a successful Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check against your spell save DC to be discerned.
Flame Trap

Trap. When Flame Trap is triggered, every second (for 3 seconds total), all nearby foes are struck for 5...17...20 fire damage and set on fire for 1...3...3 second[s]. Flame Trap ends after 90 seconds. While activating this skill, you are easily interrupted.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage each increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Defensive Stance
entries: {@variantrule Adrenaline|GW|Adrenaline:} 5, {@variantrule Stance|GW}
Assume a defensive stance, gaining adrenaline at the end of it for each melee weapon attack spell you have prepared.
For the duration, you have a +5 bonus to AC against weapon attacks.
When this spell ends, you gain one strike of adrenaline for each melee weapon attack spell you have prepared (maximum 2).
Defensive Stance

Stance. For 1...4...5 second[s], you have a 75% chance to block melee and projectile attacks. When Defensive Stance ends, you gain one strike of adrenaline for each melee attack skill you have (maximum 0...3...4).

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the duration increases by 1 round for each slot level above 1st and the maximum increases by 1 for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Mantra of Persistence
entries: {@variantrule Stance|GW}
Start repeating a mantra pf persistence, extending the duration of your illusion themed spells.
For the duration, when you cast an illusion themed spell, which targets an enemy, with a timed duration, extend that duration by 25%.
Mantra of Persistence
Stance. For 5...21...25 seconds, any Illusion Magic hex you cast lasts 10...34...40% longer.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the % increases by 25% for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Zealot's Fire
entries: {@variantrule Enchantment|GW}
Wreath allies your target with your spells in the Zealot's Flame, {@condition burning|GW} everything around them.

For the duration, when you cast a spell that targets an ally, target each hostile creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on the target. Each new target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage.
Zealot's Fire
Enchantment Spell. For 60 seconds, whenever you use a skill that targets an ally, all foes adjacent to that target are struck for 5...29...35 fire damage and you lose 1 Energy.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Well of The Profane
entries: Turn a corpse into a profane well, stripping all enemies of beneficial spells and preventing new ones from being applied.

Choose one dead creature, which has not been dead for more than 5 minutes and which has not been exploited by a spell, that you can see within range. Exploit that target; for the duration, you create a 20-foot-radius, 10-foot-high Cylinder centered on that point. Each hostile creature in that Cylinder must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, all beneficial spells on a target end, and the target cannot be the target of or benefit from beneficial spells while inside the Cylinder. A creature also makes this save if it enters the Cylinder or ends its turn there, or if the Cylinder moves into its space. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

On your later turns, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to exploit another corpse within range, which has not been dead for more than 5 minutes and which has not been exploited by a spell, to teleport the Cylinder to the location of the new corpse.
Well of the Profane

Well Spell. Exploit nearest corpse to create a Well of the Profane at its location. For 8...18...20 seconds, foes in that area are stripped of all enchantments and cannot be the target of further enchantments. (50% failure chance with Death Magic 4 or less.)

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the radius of the spell increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Winnowing
entries: {@variantrule Summoning Ritual|GW|Summoning Ritual:} {@creature Nature Ritual|GW}
Call forth a spirit of winnowing, which increases all physical damage.
Summon a nature spirit for the duration. While a creature is within 120 feet of the nature spirit and takes bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage, they take an additional {@damage 1d4} damage.
Winnowing
Nature Ritual. Create a level 1...8...10 spirit. Non-spirit creatures within range take 4 additional damage whenever they take physical damage. This spirit dies after 30...126...150 seconds.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or 4th level, the duration increases to 8 hours. When you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the duration increases to 24 hours.
Additionally, when you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Shield Bash

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within range make a weapon attack roll which is part of a spell

entries: Block an incoming attack spell with your shield.

The triggering attack misses you, and if it was a melee weapon attack, the attacker must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker is knocked {@condition prone}, and the spell can't be used again for 3 rounds.
Shield Bash

Skill. For 5...10...11 seconds, while wielding a shield, the next attack skill used against you is blocked. If it was a melee skill, your attacker is knocked down and that skill is disabled for an additional 15 seconds.

components.m: a shield worth at least 1 sp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the duration increases by 1 round for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Clumsiness
entries: {@variantrule Hex|GW}
Induce a momentary clumsiness in a group of creatures, causing their next attack to miss and inflict damage on themselves.

Choose a point that you can see within range. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, for the duration, the next time a target makes a weapon attack roll, that attack roll misses and the target takes {@damage 4d6} psychic damage. On a successful save, the target only takes the damage when it attacks.
Clumsiness
Hex Spell. For 4 seconds, target and adjacent foes are hexed with Clumsiness. The next time each foe attacks, the attack is interrupted and that foe suffers 10...76...92 damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Convert Hexes
entries: {@variantrule Enchantment|GW}
Invert the polarity of hexes affecting a creature, turning necromancy hexes into defense.

Choose one friendly creature that you can see within range. All harmful spells on the target end. For each necromancy spell ended this way, you can roll {@dice 1d4} and subtract the number rolled from the damage when the target takes damage, for the duration.
Convert Hexes
Spell. Remove all hexes from target other ally. For 8...18...20 seconds, that ally gains +10 armor for each Necromancer hex that was removed.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Barbs
entries: {@variantrule Hex|GW}
Curse a creature, to grow necrotic barbs around them, which strangle them every time they take physical damage.

Choose one creature that you can see within range. The Target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, for the duration, when the target takes bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage, they take an additional {@damage 1d6} damage.
Barbs
Hex Spell. For 30 seconds, target foe takes 1...12...15 more damage when hit by physical damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Disrupting Lunge

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within range cast a spell or using an ability

entries: {@variantrule Companion|GW}
Command your companion to attempt a Disrupting Lunge, potentially interrupting a creature.

Choose one companion, that can hear you within range. The companion uses its reaction to make an attack against a creature, which is casting a spell or using an ability, of your choice, that the companion can see within the beast's range. On a hit, the target suffers the attack's normal effects and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the ability/spell fails and has no effect.
If an ability or spell failed this way, the ability/spell can't be used again for the duration.
Disrupting Lunge

Pet Attack. Your animal companion attempts a Disrupting Lunge that deals +1...10...12 damage. If that attack strikes a foe using a skill that skill is interrupted and is disabled for an additional 20 seconds.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the duration increases by 1 round for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Ignorance
entries: {@variantrule Hex|GW}
Make a creature ignorant to the power of their signets, disabling them.
Choose one creature that you can see within range. For the duration, the target can't use signet spells.
Ignorance
Hex Spell. For 8...18...20 seconds target foe cannot use signets.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Divine Intervention
entries: {@variantrule Enchantment|GW}
Protect a creature from death for a time.

Choose one creature that you can see within range. The first time the target would drop to 0 hit points as a result of taking damage, the target instead regains hit points equal to {@dice 6d4} + your spellcasting ability modifier, and the spell ends.

If the spell is still in effect when the target is subjected to an effect that would kill it instantaneously without dealing damage, that effect is instead negated against the target, and the spell ends.
Divine Intervention
Enchantment Spell. For 10 seconds, the next time target ally receives damage that would be fatal, the damage is negated and that ally is healed for 26...197...240 Health.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Energizing Wind
entries: {@variantrule Summoning Ritual|GW|Summoning Ritual:} {@creature Nature Ritual|GW}
Summon a nature spirit of the Energizing Wind, reducing spell slot usage but preventing repeated usage.

Summon a nature spirit for the duration. While a creature is within 120 feet of the nature spirit, when they cast a spell of 1st level or higher, they cast that spell by using a spell slot which is one level lower than required, but they cannot cast spells of the same original level for 3 rounds.
Energizing Wind

Nature Ritual. Create a level 1...5...6 spirit. For non-spirit creatures within its range, all skills cost 15 less Energy (minimum cost 10 Energy), and skills recharge 25% slower. This spirit dies after 1...25...31 second[s].

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th or 7th level, the duration increases to 8 hours. When you use a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the duration increases to 24 hours.

spell.name: Berserker Stance
entries: {@variantrule Stance|GW}
Enter a mindless state of berserking, attacking faster and gaining adrenaline as long as you don't use spells or abilities.
For the duration, you can attack one additional time when you take the attack action on your turn, and your adrenaline gain is increased by 50%.
When you cast a spell or use an ability, this spell ends.
Berserker Stance
Stance. For 5...10...11 seconds, you attack 33% faster and gain 50% more adrenaline. Berserker Stance ends if you use a skill.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the % increases by 50% for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Aftershock
entries: Violently send out a shockwave, dealing more damage to {@condition prone} targets.

Target each creature other than you within a 15-foot Emanation. Each target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 3d10} force damage. If a target was {@condition prone}, the target takes an additional {@damage 2d10} force damage. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage.
Aftershock
Spell. Nearby foes are struck for 26...85...100 earth damage. Knocked down foes are struck for 10...56...68 additional earth damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage each increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Mantra of Inscriptions
entries: {@variantrule Stance|GW}
Repeat the mantra of inscriptions, imbuing your signet with improved alacrity.
For the duration, when you cast a signet, which requires a short rest before it can be cast again, it instead only requires you to exit initiative before you can cast it again.
Mantra of Inscriptions
Stance. For 5...21...25 seconds, signets you successfully activate while in this stance recharge 10...34...40% faster.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th or 6th level, the duration increases to 1 hour. When you use a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the duration increases to 8 hours.

spell.name: Draw Conditions
entries: Sacrifice yourself for a companion by taking all their conditions.

Choose one friendly creature other than you within range. You gain a copy of each harmful condition on the target. End all copied conditions on the target, and you regain hit points equal to {@dice 1d4} per condition removed.
Draw Conditions
Spell. All negative conditions are transferred from target other ally to yourself. For each condition acquired, you gain 6...22...26 Health.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by 1 for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Glyph of Elemental Power
entries: Inscribe the Glyph of Elemental Power into the air, increasing the potency of your elemental spells.

For the duration, when you cast an elemental themed spell, you can cast that spell by using a spell slot which is one level higher than the one used in the casting. After this spell triggers {@dice 1d4 + 1} times, this spell ends.
Glyph of Elemental Power
Glyph. For 25 seconds, your elemental attributes are boosted by 2 for your next 10 spells.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the amount of time this spell can trigger increases by 1 for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Mantra of Resolve
entries: {@variantrule Stance|GW}
Start repeating a mantra of resolve, improving your {@status concentration}.
For the duration, when you cast a spell, you cannot be interrupted while casting it, and you have a +5 bonus to Constitution saving throws made to hold {@status concentration} on that spell.
If you prevent an interrupt or succeed a {@status concentration} check because of this bonus, your initiative gets reduced by {@dice 2d6} or this spell ends.
Initiative cannot be reduced below 0 with this spell.
Mantra of Resolve
Stance. For 30...78...90 seconds, you cannot be interrupted, but each time you would have been interrupted, you lose 10...5...4 Energy or Mantra of Resolve ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th or 5th level, the duration increases to 1 hour. When you use a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the duration increases to 8 hours.

spell.name: Nature's Renewal
entries: {@variantrule Summoning Ritual|GW|Summoning Ritual:} {@creature Nature Ritual|GW}
Call forth a spirit of Nature's Renewal, which increases the casting time of all {@status concentration} spells and increases the load of bonds.

Summon a nature spirit for the duration. While a creature is within 120 feet of the nature spirit and casts a spell, which requires {@status concentration}, that spell requires twice as long to cast. Additionally, creatures within 120 feet of the nature spirit, which have bonds active, reduce their spell save DC and spell attack bonus by a further 1 for each active bond.
Nature's Renewal

Nature Ritual. Create a level 1...8...10 spirit. For 30...126...150 seconds, enchantments and hexes cast by non-spirit creatures in range take twice as long to cast, and it costs twice as much Energy to maintain enchantments. This spirit dies after 30...126...150 seconds.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th or 6th level, the duration increases to 8 hours. When you use a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the duration increases to 24 hours.

spell.name: Primal Echoes
entries: {@variantrule Summoning Ritual|GW|Summoning Ritual:} {@creature Nature Ritual|GW}
Summon a nature spirit of the Primal Echoes, making spells cost spell slots.

Summon a nature spirit for the duration. While a creature is within 120 feet of the nature spirit, when the creature casts a spell that does not require a spell slot, the spell still consumes a spell slot.
Primal Echoes
Nature Ritual. Create a level 1...8...10 Spirit. For non-Spirit creatures within its range, Signets cost 10 Energy to use. This Spirit dies after 30...126...150 seconds.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th or 5th level, the duration increases to 8 hours. When you use a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the duration increases to 24 hours.

spell.name: Rust
entries: {@variantrule Hex|GW}
Cause rust to appear on a group of creatures's gear and signets, dealing damage and disrupting signets.

Choose a point that you can see within range. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 2d8 + 4} cold damage, and {@variantrule signet|GW} spells take twice as long to cast for the duration. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and is affected for 1 round only.
{@variantrule Overcast|GW|Overcast:} Creatures who failed the saving throw cannot use their {@variantrule signet|GW|signets} for the duration, instead of them taking twice as long to cast.
Rust

Hex Spell. Deals 10...58...70 cold damage to target and adjacent foes. For 5...17...20 seconds, target foe and all adjacent foes take twice as long to activate signets. If you are Overcast, foes struck with Rust have their signets interrupted and disabled for 1...8...10 second[s].

components.m: a drop of water, and a pocketwatch

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8 + 2} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Soothing Images
entries: {@variantrule Hex|GW}
Project calming images into a group of creatures's minds, quenching their battle fury, preventing them from gaining Adrenaline.

Choose a point that you can see within range. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, for the duration, a target cannot gain {@variantrule Adrenaline|GW}. On a successful save, the target is affected for 1 round only.
Soothing Images
Hex Spell. For 8...18...20 seconds, target foe and all adjacent foes cannot gain adrenaline.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the radius of the spell increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Order of Pain
entries: {@variantrule Enchantment|GW}, {@variantrule Order|GW}, {@variantrule Sacrifice|GW|Sacrifice:} 17%
Induct your allies into the Order of Pain, making their physical attacks stronger.
Target each friendly creature within range. For the duration, a target's weapon attacks, which deal bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage, deal an additional {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage.
Order of Pain
Enchantment Spell. For 5 seconds, whenever a party member hits a foe with physical damage, that party member does +3...13...16 damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Warrior's Cunning
entries: {@variantrule Unblockable|GW}
Draw upon your knowledge, overcoming any unexpected defenses.
For the duration, your melee weapon attacks gain the Unblockable property.
Warrior's Cunning
Skill. For 5...10...11 seconds, your melee attacks cannot be blocked.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th or 5th level, the duration increases to 10 minutes. When you use a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the duration increases to 1 hour.

spell.name: Elemental Attunement
entries: {@variantrule  Elite|GW}, {@variantrule Enchantment|GW}
Empower your elemental magic, by attuning to all four elements at once.

For the Duration, when you cast an elemental themed spell of 1st level or higher, you can cast that spell by using a spell slot which is one level higher than the one used in the casting. Additionally, when you would expend a spell slot to cast an elemental themed spell, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 15 or higher, the spell does not expend a spell slot.

components.m: an arrow made of copper chloride

entries: Elemental Attunement

Elite Enchantment Spell. For 25...53...60 seconds, you are attuned to Air, Fire, Water, and Earth and gain +1...2...2 to these attributes. You gain 50% of the base Energy cost of the skill each time you use magic associated with any of these elements.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or 4th level, you can maintain your {@status concentration} on the spell for up to 8 hours. When you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can maintain your {@status concentration} on the spell for up to 24 hours.

spell.name: Weapons of Three Forges
entries: {@variantrule Elite|GW}, {@variantrule Weapon Spell|GWF}
Call upon the power of the great Obsidian Forge in the Fissure of Woe to bestow weapons unto your allies.

Choose any number of friendly creatures within range. For the duration, each creature is under the effect of random {@variantrule Weapon Spell|GWF}, except {@spell Weapons of Three Forges|GW}. If a spell is below the level of this spell, it is instead applied at the level of this spell. Otherwise, it is cast at the lowest level possible.
Weapons of Three Forges
Elite Weapon Spell. For 3...17...20 seconds, each non-spirit ally in earshot gains the effect of a random Weapon Spell. PvE Skill

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th or 7th level, the duration increases to 10 minutes. When you use a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the duration increases to 1 hour.

spell.name: Barrage
entries: {@variantrule Elite|GW}
Fire a large volley of arrows at a group.
Any preparation on you ends.

Choose one creature that you can see within range of your weapon. Target up to five more creatures in a 10-foot Emanation around the target. Make a ranged weapon attack against each target. On a hit, a target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and takes {@damage 1d8} damage.
Barrage
Elite Bow Attack. All your preparations are removed. Shoot arrows at target foe and up to 5 foes adjacent to your target. These arrows strike for +5...17...20 damage if they hit.

components.m: a ranged weapon worth at least 1 sp

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, a target also takes {@damage 1d8} damage for each slot level above 1st on a hit.

spell.name: Call of Haste
entries: {@variantrule Companion|GW}, {@variantrule Shout|GW}
Call to your pet to imbue it with haste.

Choose one companion that can hear you within range. For the duration, the companion can attack one additional time when it takes the attack action on its turn, and the companion's speed increases by 33%.
Call of Haste
Shout. For 30 seconds, your animal companion has a 33% faster attack speed and moves 33% faster.

spell.name: Taste of Death
entries: Suck out the life force of an undead minion you control to heal yourself.

Choose one friendly undead creature, which has been created by a spell or an ability, that you can see within range. The target loses health equal to {@dice 8d4} and you regain hit points equal to the amount of health lost.
This spell's health loss increases by {@dice 4d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 12d4}), 11th level ({@dice 16d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 20d4}).
Taste of Death
Spell. Steal up to 100...340...400 Health from target animated undead ally.

spell.name: Vow of Revolution
entries: {@variantrule Elite|GW}, {@variantrule Enchantment|GW}
Take a vow to overthrow the oppressors.
For the duration, at the start of your turn, you regain a level 1 spell slot.
When you cast a non-dervish-themed spell, the duration of this spell resets.
Vow of Revolution
Elite Enchantment Spell. For 3...9...10 seconds, you have +1...4...5 energy regeneration. This skill reapplies itself every time you use a non-Dervish skill. PvE Skill

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the level of the spell slot regained increases by 1 for every three slot levels above 2nd.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the duration increases by 1 round for each slot level above 2nd.

variantrule.name: Adrenaline
entries: Adrenaline must be spent to cast spells with the Adrenaline tag.
Instead of spending the corresponding spell slot, you spend Adrenaline equal to the number given after the tag, which is the base cost.
To upcast an Adrenaline spell, you must pay the base cost for each additional level, and you can only upcast it to a level for which you have spell slots.

You start gaining Adrenaline as soon as you prepare any spell which has the Adrenaline tag. You gain one strike of Adrenaline any time you take damage from a non-friendly source, or you deal damage to a hostile creature or object with a weapon attack.
You lose all Adrenaline outside of combat and cannot gain Adrenaline outside of combat.

variantrule.name: Armor Penetration
entries: The damage inflicted ignores damage reduction and resistance.
It does not ignore immunities.

variantrule.name: Bond
entries: For the duration of the bond, your spell save DC and spell attack bonus are reduced by 1.
You can have a maximum number of bonds active at any one time, equal to your spell casting ability modifier (minimum 1).
The bond ends if the target of your bond is ever not within 300 feet of you, or you fall unconscious (this includes going to sleep).
You can end a bond at any time (no action required).

variantrule.name: Companion
entries: Valid targets for companion spells are creatures charmed via the {@spell Charm Animal|GW} spell, or other creatures under your control, like a Beast Master Ranger’s beast companion.
Non-Valid targets are any form of summoned or created creatures, like undead created by {@spell Animate Dead|XPHB} or summoned by spells like {@spell Summon Fey|XPHB}.

variantrule.name: Elite
entries: When preparing your spells, you can only prepare one elite spell.

variantrule.name: Enchantment
entries: This spell is always treated as a concentration spell.

Treat this spell as if you were maintaining concentration on it, except that it does not break concentration of other concentration spells or abilities when cast, nor does it break concentration on itself when other concentration spells or abilities are cast.
Sometimes spells have an addendum after the tag, explaining certain changes to how the spell functions as a concentration spell.

If you are concentrating on more than one spell/ability at a time, you make your concentration saving throws with disadvantage, and if you fail your saving throw, you lose concentration on all spells/abilities.

variantrule.name: Hex
entries: See {@variantrule Enchantment|GW}.

variantrule.name: Order
entries: A creature can only ever be affected by one Order at a time.
If a new Order is applied to a creature, the old one ends immediately.

variantrule.name: Overcast
entries: Spells with Overcast tag fall (nonexclusive) into two categories, spells that cause Overcast and spells that benefit from Overcast.
Spells which cause Overcast simply have a number following the tag, indicating how many rounds of the {@condition Overcast|GW} condition they inflict on the caster.
Spells which benefit from Overcast state how they benefit from it after the tag.
If spells both cause and benefit from Overcast they first state the number of rounds they give, immediately give that amount of Overcast and then state and execute on the benefit.

variantrule.name: Preparation
entries: You can only have one Preparation active at a time.
If you activate a new Preparation, the old one ends immediately.

variantrule.name: Sacrifice
entries: You lose health equal to the percentage given after the tag of your maximum hit points.
This does not count as taking damage, nor can it be changed in any way, except by effects which specifically state that they influence how much you Sacrifice.
Sometimes spells have an addendum after the tag, explaining certain changes to how the spell functions as a Sacrifice spell.

variantrule.name: Shout
entries: Shout spells can be used once per turn at any point during your turn (no action required).
If the shout spell has its name in quotation marks the vocal component of that shout spell is its name.
The vocal compnent of shout spells must be loud enough so it can be heard from 300 feet away.

variantrule.name: Signet
entries: Signets do not require spell slots to be cast.
Signets cannot be upcast.
Each Signet is only usable once, until its recharge condition has been met.
While a Signet is recharging, it cannot be unprepared or exchanged with another spell in any way.
The following recharge conditions exist:
-Initiative: Exiting initiative, or finishing a short or long rest.
-Short Rest: Finishing a short or long rest.
-Long Rest: Finishing a long rest.
-Level Up: Gaining a level.
-Never: Will never be able to be cast again.
-Replaced: The Signet gets immediately, permanently replaced by a different spell.

variantrule.name: Stance
entries: You can only ever be in one Stance at a time.
If you enter a new Stance, the old one ends immediately.
If you are Incapacitated any Stance on you ends immediately.

variantrule.name: Summoning Ritual
entries: Only one of each type of Summoning Ritual can be active at a time, if a new one is created in the range of the Summoning Ritual, the old one ends.
The spirit created by the ritual uses the stat block specified after the tag.
When upcasting the spell, the Summoning Ritual created by the spell uses the higher level in its stat block.

variantrule.name: Unblockable
entries: Attacks with the Unblockable tag ignore any non-permanent increases to the AC of the target. This includes things like the {@spell Shield|XPHB} or {@spell Shield of Faith|XPHB} spell. It does not include things like the +1 AC bonus from a {@item +1 Shield|XDMG}.
Furthermore, attacks with the Unblockable tag ignore any effect that causes the attack to automatically miss.

variantrule.name: Weapon Attack Spell
entries: Weapon Attack Spells can be used once per attack.
Only one Cantrip Weapon Attack Spell can be used per round.

background.name: Adrenaline
entries: See {@variantrule Adrenaline|GW}.

background.name: Summoning Ritual
entries: See {@variantrule Summoning Ritual|GW}.

background.name: Unblockable
entries: See {@variantrule Unblockable|GW}.

background.name: Weapon Attack Spell
entries: See {@variantrule Weapon Attack Spell|GW}.

background.name: Air Magic
entries: No inherent effect. Many Elementalist skills, especially spells that deal lightning damage to and debilitate a single enemy, become more effective with higher Air Magic.

background.name: Axe Mastery
entries: Axe Mastery increases the damage you do with axes and your chance to inflict a critical hit when using an axe. Many skills, especially axe attack skills become more effective with higher Axe Mastery.

background.name: Beast Mastery
entries: Beast Mastery increases the damage dealt by your animal companion and its chance to inflict a critical hit. Many Ranger skills, especially those related to making your animal companion stronger, become more effective with higher Beast Mastery.

background.name: Blood Magic
entries: No inherent effect. Many Necromancer skills, especially spells that damage and steal health from your foes, become more effective with higher Blood Magic.

background.name: Curses
entries: No inherent effect. Many Necromancer skills, especially Hex spells which reduce your foes' effectiveness in battle, become more effective with higher Curses.

background.name: Death Magic
entries: Without Death Magic, you can control no more than two undead servants. For every two ranks of Death Magic, you can control one additional undead servant. Many Necromancer skills, especially those that animate undead servants, manipulate corpses, and deal cold damage, become more effective with higher Death Magic.

background.name: Divine Favor
entries: For each rank of Divine Favor, allies are healed for 3.2 whenever you cast Monk spells on them. Several Monk skills, especially spells related to Energy gain and healing, become more effective with higher Divine Favor.

background.name: Domination Magic
entries: No inherent effect. Many Mesmer skills, especially spells that disrupt spell-casting and deal direct damage, become more effective with higher Domination Magic.

background.name: Earth Magic
entries: No inherent effect. Many Elementalist skills, especially spells that protect you and your allies or deal earth damage, become more effective with higher Earth Magic.

background.name: Elementalist
entries: Elementalists summon the powers of earth, air, fire, and water and command them at will. They can inflict more damage in a single strike than any other profession. Earth Magic summons quakes and eruptions, encases enemies in stone, or protects allies. Air Magic harnesses the power of tempests to strike foes down with lightning or enable allies to run like the wind. Fire Magic manifests flames, fireballs, molten lava, and even meteors to burn enemies to a crisp. Water Magic conjures mist and ice to slow enemy movement and attacks, blur vision, protect allies against magic, and inflict cold damage on enemies. Elementalists have access to Energy regenerating skills, and when chosen as a primary character, they can increase their maximum Energy over time. The wise Elementalist avoids becoming surrounded, but keeps a local area-of-effect spell on hand just in case.

background.name: Energy Storage
entries: For each rank of Energy Storage, your maximum Energy raises by 3. Several skills related to gaining Health or Energy become more effective with higher Energy Storage.

background.name: Expertise
entries: For each rank of Expertise, the Energy cost of all of your attacks, Rituals, touch skills and Rangers [sic] skills are decreased by 4%. Several skills, especially those related to Energy costs and skill recharge times, become more effective with higher Expertise.

background.name: Fast Casting
entries: Fast Casting decreases the activation time of your Spells and Signets. (No effect for non-Mesmer skills with an activation time less than 2 seconds.) In PvE, each rank of Fast Casting decreases the recharge time for your Mesmer Spells by 3%.

background.name: Fire Magic
entries: No inherent effect. Many Elementalist skills, especially spells that burn your foes or deal fire damage in large areas, become more effective with higher Fire Magic.

background.name: Hammer Mastery
entries: Hammer Mastery increases the damage you do with hammers and your chance to inflict a critical hit when using a hammer. Many skills, especially hammer attack skills become more effective with higher Hammer Mastery.

background.name: Healing Prayers
entries: No inherent effect. Many Monk skills, especially spells related to healing, become more effective with higher Healing Prayers.

background.name: Illusion Magic
entries: No inherent effect. Many Mesmer skills, especially spells that deceive your foes and hinder their movement and attacks, become more effective with higher Illusion Magic.

background.name: Inspiration Magic
entries: No inherent effect. Many Mesmer skills, especially spells that generate energy and reduce damage, become more effective with higher Inspiration Magic.

background.name: Marksmanship
entries: Marksmanship increases the damage you do with bows and your chance to inflict a critical hit when using a bow. Many Ranger skills, especially bow attack skills, become more effective with higher Marksmanship.

background.name: Mesmer
entries: Mesmers are masters of illusion and control, subverting the enemy’s Energy for their own use, and that of their allies. Combined with any other profession, their skills provide excellent support, turning enemies’ powers against them and changing the very fabric of reality to hinder foes and help allies. Mesmers have the ability to cast spells quickly, which can make all the difference in the heat of battle. Their powers of domination allow them to take control of enemy skills and Energy. Their unique illusionary talents can slow or even halt enemy movement and skill casting, or cause imaginary illnesses that drain Health and Energy from foes while healing and energizing allies. While Mesmers are not known for brute strength, their ability to confuse, distract, and drain the enemy’s resources more than compensates.

background.name: Monk
entries: Monks employ a direct conduit to the gods, and the answers to their prayers come in the form of healing and protection for their allies and damage to their enemies. Combined with any other profession, Monks can alternate between supporting their party and dealing damage to opponents. Monks enjoy Divine Favor, which provides extra healing power, while their healing and Protection Prayers help to keep their allies strong and healthy. Smiting Prayers, on the other hand, call down divine anger on enemies, exacting holy damage that ignores armor, though damage-dealing is not the Monk’s specialty. What Monks lack in firepower they make up for with their unparalleled gift for keeping their allies alive.

background.name: Necromancer
entries: Necromancers , calling on the spirits of the dead, and even death itself, to overpower enemies and assist allies. In sacrificing Health and taking curses and diseases upon themselves, they can deal large amounts of damage to those foolish enough to oppose them. Dead and dying enemies become unwilling allies in their hands. Necromancers have the singular ability to absorb Energy from an enemy’s death, and can raise a fighting force from the corpses of their foes. Curses, which often cost the Necromancer dearly, exact an even greater toll from enemies, who find that their Enchantments and healing skills are rendered useless. Due to the sacrificial nature of their methods, Necromancers must practice patience and self-discipline to survive.

background.name: No Attribute
entries: No Attribute skills are those which are not tied to a particular attribute. Effects of these unlinked skills are almost always constant; for example, Remove Hex always removes a single hex, whereas the Protection Prayers spell, Divert Hexes removes 1...3...3 hexes, depending on the caster's rank in that attribute.

Effects of these unlinked skills are almost always constant; for example, Remove Hex always removes a single hex, whereas the Protection Prayers spell, Divert Hexes removes 1...3...3 hexes, depending on the caster's rank in that attribute.

background.name: No Profession
entries: No Attribute skills are those which are not tied to a particular profession.

background.name: Protection Prayers
entries: No inherent effect. Many monk skills, especially Enchantments that prevent damage or provide healing, become more effective with higher Protection Prayers.

background.name: Ranger
entries: Rangers are unique in their ability to succeed with the help of, or even in spite of, their environment. Nature rituals allow them to manipulate the environment to hinder their enemies, or borrow the very power of creation to heal and aid their allies. They favor long-range combat, the bow being their weapon of choice, and can be especially effective from elevated locations such as bridges and cliffs. They are the only profession with the ability to charm animals, which then accompany them on their travels and assist them in battle, gaining experience and levels over time. Rangers are also blessed with survival skills that help keep them alive by causing regeneration of health.

background.name: Smiting Prayers
entries: No inherent effect. Many Monk skills, especially those related to dealing holy damage, become more effective with higher Smiting Prayers. Holy damage is especially powerful against the undead.

background.name: Soul Reaping
entries: For each point of Soul Reaping, you gain 1 Energy whenever a non-Spirit creature near you dies. You may only gain Energy in this way 3 times every 15 seconds.

background.name: Strength
entries: When you use attack skills, each point of Strength gives you 1% armor penetration. Many skills, especially those related to surviving and inflicting damage, become more effective with higher Strength.

background.name: Swordsmanship
entries: Swordsmanship increases the damage you do with Swords and your chance to inflict a critical hit when using a sword. Many skills, especially sword attack skills become more effective with higher Swordsmanship.

background.name: Tactics
entries: No inherent effect. Many skills, especially defensive skills and skills that aid your allies, become more effective with higher Tactics.

background.name: Warrior
entries: Warriors rely on stout hearts, brute strength, and melee weapons to subdue their enemies and protect their allies. They generally disdain long-range warfare, preferring instead to charge directly into the fray swinging their weapon of choice. They can take a beating unlike anyone else. Warriors are equally comfortable wielding axe, hammer, or sword, though many choose to master one weapon over all others. Many Warrior skills require adrenaline, which builds up during combat to enable those skills, and usually results in major damage. Defensive tactics help the Warrior to avoid damage and protect allies, but Strength is the Warrior’s biggest asset, allowing this hero to do more damage with every attack.

background.name: Water Magic
entries: No inherent effect. Many Elementalist skills, especially spells that deal cold damage and slow or hinder your foes, become more effective with higher Water Magic.

background.name: Wilderness Survival
entries: No inherent effect. Many Ranger skills, especially Rituals, Preparations, and Traps, become more effective with higher Wilderness Survival.

condition.name: Bleeding
entries: A bleeding creature takes slashing damage at the start of each of its turns.
The amount of slashing damage is determined by the effect that applied it.
The condition can be ended early by regaining hit points.
Multiple instances of bleeding are independent of each other.

condition.name: Burning
entries: A burning creature takes fire damage at the start of each of its turns.
The amount of fire damage is determined by the effect that applied it.
The condition can be ended early by using an action to smother the flames.
Multiple instances of bleeding are independent of each other.

condition.name: Cracked Armor
entries: A creature with cracked armor has their AC reduced by an amount equal to the PB of the creature who applied the effect.

condition.name: Crippled
entries: A crippled creature has their speed halved.

condition.name: Dazed
entries: A dazed creature can't cast spells as reactions and must cast spells that take a bonus action as an action; any other spell takes twice as long to cast.
Additionally, they have disadvantage on Constitution saving throws that they make to maintain Concentration.
The condition can be removed by any effect that can remove the blinded, deafened, exhaustion or stunned condition.

condition.name: Deep Wound
entries: A creature with a deep wound has their hit point maximum reduced by 20%.

condition.name: Disease
entries: A diseased creature takes necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns.
The amount of necrotic damage is determined by the effect that applied it.
Any creature of the same creature type as the diseased creature that is within 10 feet of it when it starts its turn must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or gain a copy of the condition.
Multiple instances of disease are independent of each other.
The condition can be removed by any effect that can remove the poisoned condition.

condition.name: Overcast
entries: An Overcast creature temporarily loses access to spell slots level equal to twice their highest level spell slot.
The creature decides which spell slots it loses access to. They can choose expended spell slots.
Further applications of overcast add to the existing duration.

condition.name: Corruption
entries: A corrupted creature takes poison damage at the start of each of its turns.
The amount of poison damage is determined by the effect that applied it.
Multiple instances of corruption are independent of each other.
The condition can be removed by any effect that can remove the poisoned condition.

condition.name: Weakness
entries: A weakened creature deals half damage with weapons and suffers a –1 penalty to all ability scores.
Additional damage that is added to an attack is not halved (e.g., Divine Smite).

legendaryGroup.name: Bonfaaz Burntfur
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (winning initiative ties), Bonfaaz Burntfur can take a lair action to cause one of the following magical effects; Bonfaaz Burntfur can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

- Choose three points that he can see, designating them for destruction. An ominous sound can be heard when standing within 10-feet of a designated point. At initiative 0, a 3rd level {@spell Meteor|GW} will impact at the chosen points.
- Bonfaaz Burntfur rallies the charr troops, increasing their morale and improving their abilities. All allied charr gain 10 temporary hit points.
regionalEffects: If the Stormcaller horn has been blown, all charr become vulnerable to all damage, and deal only half damage.

entries.name: Age
entries: Norn can have long lives, living up to 120 and maintaining their good health and vitality for a long time, though very few die of old age.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Humanoid. You are also considered a shapeshifter for any prerequisite or effect that requires you to be a shapeshifter.

entries.name: Size
entries: Norn are around 9 feet tall and have broad builds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Menacing
entries: You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill.

entries.name: Cold Climate Adaptation
entries: You have resistance to cold damage and can't be slowed down or hindered by snowy or icy terrain.

entries.name: Become your Totem
entries: Once per Long Rest you can choose to transform into your Totem animal as an action for 1 hour.
Wild Shape rules apply.

entries.name: Age
entries: Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Humanoid.

entries.name: Size
entries: Humans are around 5 1/2 feet tall and have a wide variety of builds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Favoured by the Gods
entries: When choosing this species choose a patron god, which gives you a small amount of power in the form a cantrip, a spell and a resistance to a specific damage type. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait (choose the ability when you select this species). You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a Short Rest.

entries.name: Trained Actor
entries: When failing a Charisma d20 test you can add a d6 to that roll as a reaction. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Age
entries: Charr reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Humanoid.

entries.name: Size
entries: Charr are around 7 feet tall and have a wide build. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Cat's Talent
entries: You have proficiency in the Perception and Stealth skills.

entries.name: Military Training
entries: You have proficiency with all simple and non-two-handed martial weapons.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of grey.

entries.name: Cat's Claws
entries: You can use your claws to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with them, the strike deals 1d6 + your Strength/Dexterity modifier slashing damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Savage Attacks

entries.name: Infernal Magic
entries: You know the {@spell Lava Arrows|GW} cantrip.
Once you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell Flare|GW} spell with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest.
Once you reach 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell Fireball (Guild Wars)|GW} spell with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest.
Once you reach 7th level, you can also cast the {@spell Meteor|GW} spell with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest.
Once you reach 9th level, you can also cast the {@spell Phoenix|GW} spell with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest.
Once you reach 11th level, you can also cast the {@spell Meteor Shower|GW} spell with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest.
Once you reach 13th level, you can also cast the {@spell Rodgort's Invocation|GW} spell with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest.
You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma can be the spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Age
entries: Dwarves mature at the same rate as humans, but they're considered young until they reach the age of 50. On average, they live about 350 years.

entries.name: Size
entries: Dwarves stand between 4 and 5 feet tall and average about 150 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your speed is not reduced by wearing heavy armor.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Dwarven Combat Training
entries: You have proficiency with all simple weapons and the {@item battleaxe|phb}, {@item handaxe|phb}, {@item light hammer|phb}, and {@item warhammer|phb}.

entries.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with the artisan's tools of your choice: {@item Smith's tools|phb}, {@item brewer's supplies|phb}, or {@item mason's tools|phb}.

entries.name: Invoke the Great Dwarf
entries: As a reaction when you fail a saving throw you can send out a prayer to the great Dwarf. When you do so you succeed on that saving throw instead. Once you use this feature you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Dwarven Toughness
entries: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.
